body_html:
@yongtang Thanks a lot for PR #13145
I plan to upload my branch with support for system sqlite3, jpeg and others after some cleanups.
It can then be enhanced from there.

One cleanup that may be it makes sense to be done before adding support for system libraries is to rename variables like jemalloc_STATIC_LIBRARIES to something like jemalloc_ext_LIBRARIES as they will not always be dynamic.

Another is to cleanup targets like gif_copy_headers_to_destination so that they are not depended outside of the module, as the system library version of it would not have such thing.

@yongtang Thanks a lot for PR #13145
I plan to upload my branch with support for system sqlite3, jpeg and others after some cleanups.
It can then be enhanced from there.
One cleanup that may be it makes sense to be done before adding support for system libraries is to rename variables like jemalloc_STATIC_LIBRARIES to something like jemalloc_ext_LIBRARIES as they will not always be dynamic.
Another is to cleanup targets like gif_copy_headers_to_destination so that they are not depended outside of the module, as the system library version of it would not have such thing.
body:
@yongtang Thanks a lot for PR #13145 
I plan to upload my branch with support for system sqlite3, jpeg and others after some cleanups.
It can then be enhanced from there.

One cleanup that may be it makes sense to be done before adding support for system libraries is to rename variables like `jemalloc_STATIC_LIBRARIES` to something like `jemalloc_ext_LIBRARIES` as they will not always be dynamic.

Another is to cleanup targets like `gif_copy_headers_to_destination` so that they are not depended outside of the module, as the system library version of it would not have such thing.
